title: Two data sets and one velocity vs time graph

content.description: A student wants to launch a toy dart toward a target that hangs from a light string. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the dart is launched with an initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal ground. At the instant the dart is launched, the string is cut such that the target begins to fall straight down. The positive horizontal direction is considered to be to the right, and the positive vertical direction is considered to be up.
content.question: A student makes the necessary measurements to create the graph shown, which represents the vertical component of the velocity as a function of time for the dart and for the target from <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> until the instant the dart hits the target. At <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the target is a vertical distance <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the dart. The curves for the dart and the target each have the same area between them and the horizontal axis. Both curves also have the same slope. Which of the following is the best method to determine the distance <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from the graph?

choices.label: Find the area under the curve for the dart’s data.
Find twice the area under the curve for the dart’s data.
Find the slope of the curve for the dart’s data.
Find twice the slope of the curve for the dart’s data.

content.answer: Find twice the area under the curve for the dart’s data.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
